TopicTitle: Do FAR SSTO Spaceplanes work with NEAR?

Articles.Content:
Hi

I don't use FAR and i don't plan to. I tried it and it is in no way fun anymore for me to launch rockets. However i quite like NEAR :-)

But i do strugle with planes, let alone Spaceplanes. So i want to ask can i use a FAR craft file in NEAR or will it not fly ?

Also are there any caveheats i should know about bulding planes in NEAR or is it almost stock like (design wise) ?

Thanks

ManuxKerb

Edited April 12, 2015 by ManuxKerb
It should. It may work better in NEAR due to NEARs simplified version.

AFAIK, NEAR is just FAR without calculating drag changes due to velocity. So the following should apply:

In NEAR, what flies well subsonic will fly well supersonic.

In FAR, what flies well subsonic may or may not fly well supersonic.

From that I would say that if if flies well subsonic in FAR, it should perform well at any velocity in NEAR.

I could, of course, be wrong

From my experience Deutherius is probably right. I am a NEAR user and a few months ago I tried my luck at FAR. My favourite NEAR SSTO performed beautifully at both subsonic and supersonic speeds. But as soon as I engaged my rocket engines to go hypersonic I lost control each and every time.

From my experience Deutherius is probably right. I am a NEAR user and a few months ago I tried my luck at FAR. My favourite NEAR SSTO performed beautifully at both subsonic and supersonic speeds. But as soon as I engaged my rocket engines to go hypersonic I lost control each and every time.

WOW this plane looks awesome!!! Does it have payload ?

Would you mind shareing your craft file ?

Thanks

WOW this plane looks awesome!!! Does it have payload ?

Would you mind shareing your craft file ?

Thanks

As a matter of fact I have a few variations on this beauty. The one I posted is the standard version; small Mk2 cargobay and Mk2 docking port. The second is designed for crew; Mk2 crew pod and Mk2 docking port. For the third I had to sacrifice the docking port for the large Mk2 cargobay.

All three have very similar flying characteristics and can reach Mun/Minmus orbit with relative ease.

There are only a few mod parts and only a few are tweakscaled.

Normally I rarely share craft but for this one I am willing to make an exception. I'll see if I can rescale/replace them with stock parts and still retain the design and functionality. But it will have to wait till tomorrow.

Edited April 12, 2015 by Tex_NL
